Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: welshwaspy
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here at the end of March after driving down from Las Vegas. Very tired motel with poor fixtures and fittings. I was originally placed over the boiler room where the floor shock violently although there was no issue when I asked to change the room. I ended up paying GBP40 for the night which was a rip off as I stayed in much better accommodation in Las Vegas for less. It states it is by the airport but in fact it is a 10 minute drive away so don't be fooled. There was nowhere decent to eat in the immediate area and we had the drive in downtown Phoenix to get some food which was a pain. I wouldn't recommend this place unless you are struggling to find somewhere to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I got a great deal on this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: justinbbfc
Reviews.Content: Not sure why everyone is rating things so poorly here, maybe we just got lucky? My room was very clean and the size was quite big. I paid 28 dollars a night through priceline and everything was very clean and nice. My only complaint was the dryer in the washer/dryer room sucked horribly and they don't pick up from the airport 24 hours a day, also there is no room service that cleans your room. Room had a fridge, stove, microwave, and all the amenities that one would need for a night or even a few days. A costco is right across the street and a few other restaurants scattered around it for breakfast. The value was incredible for the room that we received. I would recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget that is traveling in Phoenix with a car. T

Reviews.Title: “Better than sleeping in your car.”
Reviews.Author: Loyd78
Reviews.Content: Bathroom toilet was indescribably gross. We tried to call the front desk but the phone was not functional. The rest of the room was fairly clean. The bed was not comfortable but we were only staying one night so we endured. The wifi, tv and recliner chair were above average. For $40, we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: SamyWillis103
Reviews.Content: The room is under par. The hall smells, the rooms smell, there is a major lack of dishes and our keys never worked in the door. Disappointing it looked likes. Alright place.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you would expect (if you do your research)”
Reviews.Author: R77556
Reviews.Content: ExtendedStay America hotels are one of my first choices when I travel for business. What's important to me is an inexpensive clean room. The fact that they have a fridge, stovetop, microwave & dishwasher are, in my mind, a big plus. These places were designed for people who are staying for an extended time usually doing some temporary work in the area. You're likely to find a lot of tradespeople, salespeople and folks that have sold a home and are waiting to move into a new one. I've also met a number of retirees travelling on a budget. For these groups this place is a perfect fit. Most of the complaints that I've read about ESA seem to be from people who have unreasonable expectations. These are not resort destinations like a Marriot or a Hilton. I like to think of them as a "workingman's hotel." I stayed here last night before driving down to Tucson. I chose it for it's proximity to the airport. My room was extremely well laid out and clean. There was a sofabed & a queensize, a cathode TV (not a flatscreen) with a remote that needed a battery. (isn't that always the case with hotels?) The two kitchenette chairs were obviously new, but the sofabed was worn & a little threadbare. No problem, I turned one of the cushions over and it looked fine. In general, the room suted my needs just fine. following are what I consider the good and the not-so-good about this, and the entire chain of ExtendedStay America, hotel: The Good - Great water pressure and hot water in the shower. There is nothing worse then a morning shower that feels like it's coming from a garden hose on the "sprinkler" setting. Proximity to the airport - less then a 15 minute drive. Very clean Well laid out kitchen. Where improvements could be made: The bed. This is my biggest complaint with all the ExtendedStay America Hotels that I have stayed in. The bed is hard. Not firm, hard. Rock hard. Guys, please upgrade your mattresses. That would certainly raise you at least a star in the reviews. The shower curtain. Most hotels have gone to the type of curtain rod that semicircles the shower curtain out of the tub. Not here. Since this was a business trip I traveled without my wife. But I almost thought that she was in the shower with me the way the shower curtain kept wanting to wrap itself around me.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: flyermontana
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at ESAs before that were pretty dismal. But this one was really a nice surprise. Extremely clean, spacious room, full kitchen and huge bathroom in room (but bring your own toiletries), large HD flat screen TV with lots of channels, very comfortable beds. We had a good night's sleep, very close to the airport in a quiet and safe area (not much around in terms of food though). The wifi is not free, BUT they do have access to Boingo and other roaming providers, so if you have an account with one of them you're all set. Overall, this is a terrific value and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The most discusting place I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: goodmaggie
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be investigated by the health department. The drawers and cabinets were full of garbage and hair. The mattrices were stained along with the blankets. There was a 1 1/2 inch gap below the enterance door so I am full of bug bites. The bigest issue I have is when I reported all these things the staff did absolutely NOTHING about it. The entire cleaning staff should be fired. If you are looking for a 1 star hotel, this is the place. I don't need luxery I just wanted clean but didn't get it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place... don't go”
Reviews.Author: ikazi
Reviews.Content: This is truely a one star hotel. The room smells, they were sold out & couldn't move me out or fix the problem. The flush broke on the second day. There is filter coffee, but no filter. No hangers in the coat rack. The iron was bust... name it this place had crazy issues... it didn't have free net or a breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “OK place!”
Reviews.Author: PatOtoole
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with the ESA to begin with. Then again for this price you might not be able to complain too much. Overall it was clean, the services was OK, as was the room but it was ordinary. I did not feel like the ESA would try very hard to be a little more than average. It is the attention to detail that I was missing. Other than that it is a solid place and I would recommend it to anybody travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly place with awful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Relmartin323
Reviews.Content: We booked this room because of the price, never again!!! The girl at the front desk seemed nice at first but she sent the manager running as we checked in at 5 to see if our room was clean, apparently they only clean these rooms when they get a booking, giving the bodily fluids plenty of time to sink into the fabrics and carpet. We were finally given our room key and sent along only to find the manager running around in our room spraying air freshner like a crazy person and the maid still trying to vacuum. We stood there like morons waiting with our bags in hand as the manager said " oh did you want to come in here?" even though she had called down to the office to send us up. We got into our room only to find the ac not working on a 105 degree day. When we called the front desk the girl argued with us about our interpretation of a broken ac. We were placed in a new room that was just as stinky and disgusting and the ac was more like a fan, which just doesn't cut it. I am currently at the hotel and seriously debating whether or not to leave and pay full price for a hotel next door!!!!! Don't stay here if you can help it!!!!! Oh and just to give you an accurate description of the smell.... Imagine three week old onion rings inside a diaper bin!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: twiggysara
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, and it was a great "transition hotel." I got into town in the late evening and I just needed someplace to sleep until I moved onto my next destination. The price was inexpensive and it had a kitchenette and couch.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel at a modest price”
Reviews.Author: Elderhostel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is designed for the traveler staying an extended period of time. Each room has a kitchenette equipped with cups, plates, silverware & cooking pots. Wireless internet access is available for a modest one-time fee. Housekeeping is on a weekly basis. I've stayed at this hotel on several occasions and have always been pleased. It is conveniently located for freeway access. The property is well maintained and a helpful staff. The only downside is the lack of restaurants within walking distance. In addition to restaurants in the two adjacent hotels, only a Waffle House open on a 24 hour basis is available.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: stampinjudy
Reviews.Content: I have been 'living' during the week in the Extended Stay America. It has been a very pleasurable experience. It is very quiet and clean. The people who work there are very hospitable, especially Kim at the front desk. She goes beyond what she would need to when presented with a request (I would not even call it a problem because she handles it in such a quick, professional way). Thanks, Kim!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: angiecphx
Reviews.Content: It may not have the little complimentry lotion, shampo and conditioner but it has a little kitchen with everything you need to prepare your own meals, if you like to save money on take out, you can bring and cook your own food. Love it for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Extended Stay is fine for economical lodging”
Reviews.Author: CyndyJoy
Reviews.Content: We paid $38 through Priceline which made this is very decent deal. It is near the rental car facility and the airport. I saw modest but clean houses in the area along with a Costco and Sears across the street - not quite the slums as some saw it. The outside was clean and quiet. It is not located in a 'hotel row' area. It is not a Deluxe Extended Stay so there is no Continental breakfast. There is a small kitchen with microwave, 2 burner stove and full size fridge. Yes the room could use a fresh coat of paint and the bed a new bedspread but it was clean. Everything worked included the A/C. Concerning Tripadvisor reviewers: be advised that we are 'cup is half full or half empty' types. Regardless of the number of stars a hotel has there are those who go out of their way to find fault. If you cannot handle a modest hotel that is probably ready for a remodel but basically does the job in providing a clean place to sleep then for the money this is a good deal. If you want a nice new hotel surrounded by other nice new hotels then be prepared to pay 2x-3x the price. If you are like us and have been vacationing elsewhere and are just in Phoenix for a night to catch a flight home then this should fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Survived the one night!”
Reviews.Author: CruzinFool
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night near the airport. As we've used this brand before, we thought this would be an acceptable place to stay. Fortunately, we'd paid less than half of the posted rates through Priceline. Now we know why! It's in a rather marginal area of town. It's an old place, one of those that has probably operated under a dozen different names by this time. The mirror in the room fell off the wall with a mere touch. There is a kitchen, but the burner ring on the stove was bent and the burner would not sit flat. Breakfast not provided, but we had some breakfast items with us. There is an additional charge for internet which we chose not to use as we knew PHX had free wireless available so we just waited til morning at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Solid price and dependale accommodations”
Reviews.Author: DaveNTempe
Reviews.Content: First of all the price was right ($45/night). TV was oddly positioned off the kitchen, but was OK and a small suite type of room was clean overall. Heated pool was a nice perk as well as the complimentary airport shuttle. Doubt I'd pay the full price, but it was a good experience with no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, clean no-frills”
Reviews.Author: MsTerri
Reviews.Content: I am at the hotel now, in the middle of a two week stay for business. The most important things to me are cleanliness, security and a decent bed. The room is generally clean, but not perfectly clean...ie dust between the slats of a wooden desk chair, the door handle on the refrig shows a bit of dirt. But the carpet is relatively new and clean, the sheets are crisp and white, the bed is comfortable. The full kitchenette is handy, there is plenty of hot water in the shower and there have been none of the plumbling problems a previous reviewer experienced. The hotel has interior doors and the front door locks at 11 pm, you need your key to enter after that. This is preferrable to having exterior doors IMHO. Over all, it's not fancy, but it's decent and priced right.
